summary: you know what annoys me the most about the finale? it's that it reinforces the part of the fandom that sees eve as a poor...
question: you know what annoys me the most about the finale? it's that it reinforces the part of the fandom that sees eve as a poor innocent victim of circumstance, as if she didn't get into this situation on her own, willingly, and enthusiastically. she knew all along who villanelle was, and that's what attracted her, but now some people paint v as abusive and eve as just another anna and that shit grates
answer:
I didn’t see it quite that way when I first watched it but it combined with the interviews does leave a bad taste in my mouth :/

Taking away the context of the interviews, the only thing I really didn’t like about the finale was Eve’s line about how Villanelle wants her to be scared and helpless because that wasn’t how I interpreted it at all? If Villanelle wants Eve in that way, then why did she view Eve stabbing her as a good thing? And wouldn’t she want Eve to NOT be a killer if she wanted her meek and helpless? And she kept on insisting that she and Eve “are the same”. For me, I thought Villanelle manipulated Eve into killing Raymond because she wanted her to embrace the dark nature Villanelle believes is in her. And she thought Eve’s denial of that part of herself was what was keeping them from being together. I don’t blame Eve for thinking that’s how Villanelle wants her but if that was the true message the writers were trying to convey? Nah.

Villanelle has a very warped view of love and she does clearly see Eve as someone for her to posses. But up until the last few minutes of the finale, I felt like it was clear that part of what attracted her to Eve was the fact that she saw dark potential in her and a challenge. So that’s another thing that I’ve been left confused about.

tags: white wlws die mad abt it
summary: honestly i don't know if it's the white wlw that fuel the notion of renormalizing stockholm syndrome with the obsessive...
body:
honestly i don’t know if it’s the white wlw that fuel the notion of renormalizing stockholm syndrome with the obsessive fetishization of oksana/eve by seeing them in a romantic lens in the ke fanbase or anything but just because you find any wlw rep that isn’t puritanical mean it’s good?? viewers are literally going out of their way to justify oksana shooting eve in the finale due to her mental state but that mentality has been there since the show started???? oksana drove over nadia out of the vindication of solitude, merely for the writers to extract comical & brutalized images to villainize her psychopathy. she was willing to shoot anna out of personal gain, but anna was pushed into emotional shock and committed suicide instead with the vilification/manipulation oksana treated her with.

oksana shot eve because she couldn’t attain her object of desire.

their dirty talk during eve & hugo’s sex clearly, clearly paints that their relationship is built on the hypersexualization of the idea of “letting loose” too. it doesn’t mean falling in love; even with oksana’s gaudy efforts of taking eve away, assaulting eve’s husband just so eve wouldn’t come back to him & vice versa, oksana acting as a barrier. it’s manipulation; and anna and eve are literal foils as a testament to this.

moreover, this fetishistic behaviour from oksana isn’t subliminal. their first meeting itself showed that oksana takes eve at face value. the “asian woman with amazing hair” as her most prominent view eve, even. oksana buying her french designer clothes is a reiterated move from her relationship with anna too; as if to her, there was a sort of pathology in relationships (and you can’t reason it’s because of her limited “"social cues”“; that’s ableist projection). this recycled action is rather a marking or a show of ownership.

& it’s ironic that villaneve stans specify on how special eve was to oksana, running on the assumption that oksana hasn’t recycled similar persuasions/advances toward nadia and anna alone.

also, this isn’t a commentary based on the double standard of consuming wlw media, but the commodification of psychotic behaviour being villainized & the bisexual-coded asian woman being intentionally brutalized by a white biwlw on-screen. oksana emotionally & psychologically manipulates eve into paralleling her out of solitude & yearn for mutual reciprocity and an out for innate anti-sociality; but it doesn’t imply romantic love. and not "shipping” them isn’t inherent ableism. there are just too many roots of coercion to it.

blog.name: thesilverstaganddoe
blog.description: I used to write for other stuff. Then I went away for a while. Now I'm writing for Killing Eve (might be just a bit slightly obsessed). I make some gifs too. Feel free to request things!

title: All the Pasta
body:
AO3 Link

Summary: Just a short fluffy thing in the alternative ending where Eve and Villanelle ran off together. They’re in the hotel and Villanelle goes out to pick up dinner.

The foam take-out containers were stacked up to just under Villanelle’s eyeline and a large paper bag, seemingly stuffed full of more hung off each of her wrists. She stumbled as she came in the door of the hotel room and the first few containers slid off the top of the stack; Eve just barely managed to catch them.

“Villanelle what is all this?”

“Well, I wasn’t sure what you wanted. At first I figured, ‘spaghetti’ meant long thing noodles with that red sauce. But then I wasn’t sure if you’d want those balls of meat in it or not. And they had big balls and small balls. So I got both. But they also had the meat just ground up. So I got that. They also had this strange one with bacon, I think? I got that too. But then I thought maybe you wouldn’t want meat at all. I know you’re not a vegetarian, but sometimes people don’t like to eat meat right after they kill someone for the first time, so I got one with just the sauce.”

“Villanelle-”

Villanelle didn’t seem to hear Eve, “They also had the red sauce that was more spicy. I wasn’t sure if you like spicy or not. You liked that Shepherd’s pie thing and that wasn’t spicy but you’re not a boring person so I would think you might like spicy food. So I got all those other ones also with the spicy sauce.”

“Villanelle-”

She continued on without a breath, “And then I realized that maybe you didn’t even mean the red sauce you just meant the long skinny noodles with some other sauce. They had that white milky sauce with that dry skinny cheese. Do you know what I mean? So I got one of those. And one of those with chicken because maybe you want meat but don’t like beef, perhaps. I was worried maybe milk isn’t good for you, so I made sure some of the red sauce ones didn’t have cheese.”

“Villanelle!” Eve exclaimed, taking the last of the containers from Villanelle’s hands, setting them on the table and grabbing her by the shoulders and shaking her slightly. She finally stopped rambling, looking slightly flustered. Eve laughed affectionately, “Villanelle, it’s fine. You didn’t have to do this. Anything you got would have been perfect. I just wanted to have dinner with you.”

“Oh,” Villanelle looked surprised, “Okay. I just wanted to make sure it was good for you.”

Eve took a step forward, cupping Villanelle’s face with her hands and resting her forehead against Villanelle’s. Several moments of silence passed between.

Finally, Eve spoke, “I love you, too.” Villanelle sucked in her breath.

Eve heard the two bags drop to the floor and suddenly Villanelle’s arms were around her waist and their lips were pressed together. When they broke apart, their fast-paced breathing was in sync.

“Yes,” Villanelle said, “Really?”

“Really.”

“I love you, too.”

“I know. Let’s have dinner.”

“Alright,” Villanelle said, picking the bags back up.

Eve gave her another quick peck on the lips. “Thank you, babe.”

“Always.”

Summary: Just a short fluffy thing in the alternative ending where Eve and Villanelle ran off together. They’re in the hotel and Villanelle goes out to pick up dinner.

reblog.comment:
AO3 Link

Summary: Just a short fluffy thing in the alternative ending where Eve and Villanelle ran off together. They’re in the hotel and Villanelle goes out to pick up dinner.

[[MORE]]

The foam take-out containers were stacked up to just under Villanelle’s eyeline and a large paper bag, seemingly stuffed full of more hung off each of her wrists. She stumbled as she came in the door of the hotel room and the first few containers slid off the top of the stack; Eve just barely managed to catch them.

“Villanelle what is all this?”

“Well, I wasn’t sure what you wanted. At first I figured, ‘spaghetti’ meant long thing noodles with that red sauce. But then I wasn’t sure if you’d want those balls of meat in it or not. And they had big balls and small balls. So I got both. But they also had the meat just ground up. So I got that. They also had this strange one with bacon, I think? I got that too. But then I thought maybe you wouldn’t want meat at all. I know you’re not a vegetarian, but sometimes people don’t like to eat meat right after they kill someone for the first time, so I got one with just the sauce.”

“Villanelle-”

Villanelle didn’t seem to hear Eve, “They also had the red sauce that was more spicy. I wasn’t sure if you like spicy or not. You liked that Shepherd’s pie thing and that wasn’t spicy but you’re not a boring person so I would think you might like spicy food. So I got all those other ones also with the spicy sauce.”

“Villanelle-”

She continued on without a breath, “And then I realized that maybe you didn’t even mean the red sauce you just meant the long skinny noodles with some other sauce. They had that white milky sauce with that dry skinny cheese. Do you know what I mean? So I got one of those. And one of those with chicken because maybe you want meat but don’t like beef, perhaps. I was worried maybe milk isn’t good for you, so I made sure some of the red sauce ones didn’t have cheese.”

“Villanelle!” Eve exclaimed, taking the last of the containers from Villanelle’s hands, setting them on the table and grabbing her by the shoulders and shaking her slightly. She finally stopped rambling, looking slightly flustered. Eve laughed affectionately, “Villanelle, it’s fine. You didn’t have to do this. Anything you got would have been perfect. I just wanted to have dinner with you.”

“Oh,” Villanelle looked surprised, “Okay. I just wanted to make sure it was good for you.”

Eve took a step forward, cupping Villanelle’s face with her hands and resting her forehead against Villanelle’s. Several moments of silence passed between.

Finally, Eve spoke, “I love you, too.” Villanelle sucked in her breath.

Eve heard the two bags drop to the floor and suddenly Villanelle’s arms were around her waist and their lips were pressed together. When they broke apart, their fast-paced breathing was in sync.

“Yes,” Villanelle said, “Really?”

“Really.”

“I love you, too.”

“I know. Let’s have dinner.”

“Alright,” Villanelle said, picking the bags back up.

Eve gave her another quick peck on the lips. “Thank you, babe.”

“Always.”
